feed.title: Hazelcast Jet Blog
feed.subtitle: The best place to stay up-to-date with the latest Hazelcast Jet news and events.

entry.title: Jet 4.5 Released
entry.summary:
Today we're releasing Hazelcast Jet 4.5, the second release this year! We're bringing Jet closer to IMDG, unifying their SQL syntax and features. Our goal is to have a single SQL dialect that seamlessly uses the features of both Jet and IMDG.

This ve...

entry.title: Jet 4.4 Released
entry.summary:
Today we're releasing Hazelcast Jet 4.4 and we have some exciting new features!

Jet SQL

Hazelcast Jet 4.4 brings you the first beta version of our SQL interface. You can now log into Jet from the command line and issue queries against the data source...

entry.title: Enabling Full-text Search with Change Data Capture in a Legacy Application
entry.summary: In this post, we will take a legacy application and improve its search functionality. We will do this with only a few changes to the application itself. Using a technique called change data capture (CDC) we will listen for changes in a database and r...

entry.title: Change Data Capture meets Stream Processing
entry.summary:
Introduction

Change Data Capture (CDC) refers to the process of observing changes made to a database and extracting them in a form usable by other systems, for the purposes of replication, analysis and many more.

Hazelcast Jet is a distributed, light...

entry.title: Transactional connectors in Hazelcast Jet
entry.summary: Hazelcast Jet is a distributed stream processing engine which supports exactly-once semantics even in the presence of cluster member failures. This is achieved by snapshotting the internal state of the processors at regular intervals into a reliable...

entry.title: Stream Deduplication with Hazelcast Jet
entry.summary:
Hazelcast Jet 3.2 introduces stateful map, filter, and flatmap operations, which are very strong primitives. In this blog, I am going to show you how to use stateful filter for detecting and removing duplicate elements in a stream.

Why Deduplication?...
